intro: Scolosanthus leonardii, commonly known as the Leonard's scolosanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Scolosanthus leonardii is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
